skill.name: skill-from-masters
skill.description: Help users create high-quality skills by discovering and incorporating proven methodologies from domain experts. Use this skill BEFORE skill-creator when users want to create a new skill - it enhances skill-creator by first identifying expert frameworks and best practices to incorporate. Triggers on requests like "help me create a skill for X" or "I want to make a skill that does Y". This skill guides methodology selection, then hands off to skill-creator for the actual skill generation.
skill.summary: Help users create high-quality skills by discovering and incorporating proven methodologies from dom...
skill.author: GBSOSS

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. It guides users through a methodology discovery process using a local database and web search triggers. No data exfiltration, code execution, network calls, or persistence mechanisms detected.

content.value_statement: Creating skills from scratch often misses proven frameworks. This skill helps discover expert methodologies so your skills embody the wisdom of recognized masters.
actual_capabilities: Consults local methodology database with 100+ expert frameworks
Searches web for expert sources and golden examples
Guides collaborative methodology selection with users
Extracts actionable principles from primary sources
Cross-validates insights across multiple expert sources
Hands off to skill-creator for final skill generation
limitations: Does not generate final skills directly (requires skill-creator)
Cannot access proprietary or paid expert content
Quality depends on web search results availability

use_cases.title: Build expert-backed skills
use_cases.description: Create skills grounded in proven methodologies from recognized masters.

use_cases.title: Codify expert knowledge
use_cases.description: Transform your domain expertise into reusable AI skills.

use_cases.title: Structure content frameworks
use_cases.description: Apply expert frameworks like Pyramid Principle or Design Sprint.

prompt_templates.title: Start skill creation
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a skill for [specific task]. Help me discover expert methodologies I can use.

prompt_templates.title: Compare frameworks
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare the [framework A] and [framework B] methodologies for my [use case] skill.

prompt_templates.title: Find golden examples
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the best examples of [output type] from top companies like Amazon, Intercom, or Google.

prompt_templates.title: Extract principles
prompt_templates.prompt: Distill the core principles and implementation steps from [expert name]'s methodology on [topic].

output_examples.input: I want to create a skill for writing product requirement documents
output: Expert frameworks found: Marty Cagan (problem-first PRDs), Barbara Minto (Pyramid Principle), Amazon (6-pager narrative)
Golden examples: Intercom PRD template, Linear spec format
Common pitfalls: jumping to solutions, writing for engineers instead of alignment, missing success metrics
Recommended approach: Start with problem space, then solution space, using Amazon's working backwards format

best_practices: Start with the local database then search for additional expert sources
Always find primary sources, not just summaries or secondhand accounts
Cross-validate insights across multiple experts before selecting a framework
anti_patterns: Using vague or generic instructions instead of expert-derived principles
Skipping web search and relying only on the local database
Selecting a framework without finding concrete examples of excellence

faq.question: Which AI tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through standard prompt triggers.

faq.question: How many methodologies are in the database?
faq.answer: Over 100 expert frameworks across 10 domains including writing, product, sales, and leadership.

faq.question: Does this skill store user data?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads from the local database and makes temporary web search queries.

faq.question: Can I combine multiple methodologies?
faq.answer: Yes. The workflow explicitly supports selecting 1-3 complementary methodologies and synthesizing them.

faq.question: What happens after I select a methodology?
faq.answer: The skill extracts actionable principles then hands off to skill-creator for actual skill generation.

faq.question: How is this different from skill-creator?
faq.answer: Skill-creator generates skills from prompts. This skill finds expert methodologies first to enhance skill-creator.
